text: officials say it's the worst
technological disaster in the entire
history of the famous Moscow Metro at
midmorning on Tuesday three carriages of
a train in the center of the city derail
many hours after rescues were still
trying to pull people out of the
crumpled metal by mid-afternoon they
speculated there was nobody left alive
the injured and those who escaped
unharmed were let out along hundreds of
meters of track after spending more than
an hour in a dark tunnel the dozens of
wounded had to be brought out on
stretchers the most gravely injured were
flown out to hospital caused by people
flung against the wall of the carriages
which derailed I spoke to one lady she
had a bad cut on her leg she said she
was thrown into war and in two bits of
smashed glass another one I was told was
concussed
by a fire extinguisher which was flung
off the wall but this does not mean the
casualties were not severe the number of
death kept rising through the day
Moscow underground so bombs and
explosions but nothing like this from a
split-second malfunction of something
just what exactly is yet unknown Moscow
authorities gave a number of theories
from loss of current to sagging track to
a faulty point on the line investigation
has been launched the city's mayor
promised to return the affected line to
service in two days for these two days
and long after millions of passengers in
the Moscow underground will feel uneasy
at the every shake of the Train they're
in but with fear or not they will have
to keep using it in the city of at least
15 million people Metro is the most
functional way of transport like Boulder
if BBC News Moscow
